intro: Tithymalus tanaiticus, commonly known as the Tanaitic tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a delicate, fern-like appearance. Tithymalus tanaiticus is typically found in rocky or arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
